  • Uses of CheckerCurrency in specialized_checkers

    Subclasses with type arguments of type CheckerCurrency in specialized_checkers
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    CheckerCurrency
    CheckerCurrency is a specialized checker for validating and performing assertions on Currency values.
    Methods in specialized_checkers that return CheckerCurrency
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static CheckerCurrency
    CheckerCurrency.check(Currency currency)
    Creates a new CheckerCurrency instance for the given currency with a default name.
    static CheckerCurrency
    CheckerCurrency.check(Currency currency, String name)
    Creates a new CheckerCurrency instance for the given currency and name.
    CheckerCurrency
    CheckerCurrency.hasSymbol(String symbol)
    Checks if the currency has the specified symbol in the default locale.
    CheckerCurrency
    CheckerCurrency.hasSymbol(String symbol, Locale locale)
    Checks if the currency has the specified symbol in the given locale.
    CheckerCurrency
    CheckerCurrency.isFrom(Locale locale)
    Checks if the currency is the one used in the specified locale.
    protected CheckerCurrency
    CheckerCurrency.self()
    Returns this instance (for fluent API usage).
    CheckerCurrency
    CheckerCurrency.withDefaultFractionDigits(int n)
    Checks if the currency has the specified number of default fraction digits.
